question: Granules of Eleidin are present in which of the following layer?
exp: Stratum Lucidum - Also called clear cell layer. Present only in skin of palms and soles. Translucent due to presence of refractile Eleidin granules

question: Normal turnover rate of epidermis:
exp: Epidermal turnover time - skin doubling time -Time taken by keratinocytes to move from Stratum Basale to environment. -Around 14 days are required to move from Stratum Basale to reach lowermost layer of Stratum Corneum & 14 days to cross Stratum Corneum. -Sloughing off requires 28 days So total ETT =56 days (8 weeks) The turnover time in psoriasis = 4 days.

question: Odland bodies are seen in which layer of epidermis?
exp: Odland bodies are present is: Skin: Stratum granulosum > upper pa of stratum spinosum. Lungs: Type-II alveolar cells in lungs Odland bodies also are known as lamellar bodies - play impoant roles in barrier function and intercellular cohesionwithin the stratum corneum. Consist of Ceramide, Fatty acids, cholesterol, etc. Stratum granulosum also contain prefillagrin(keratohyaline) Stratum lucidium has retractile granules of eleidin

question: Non-nucleated cells are seen in?
exp: Stratum corneum also known as horny layer consists of cells without nucleus and hence does not divide. This layer functions as a mechanical barrier and prevents entry of microbes from environment into the body as well as prevents leakage of fluids from body to environment.

question: The epidermis is thinnest on the?
exp: The thickness of the epidermis varies in different types of skin. It is the thinnest on the eyelids at. 05 mm and the thickest on the palms and soles at 1. 5 mm.

question: Which of these has dense irregular connective tissue?
exp: Dense irregular connective tissue: This type of tissue contains a dense woven network of collagenous (and some elastic) fibers in a viscous matrix. It is found in - Joint capsules Muscle fascia Dermis of skin

question: Which of the following connects the basal layer to the basement membrane zone?
exp: Hemidesmosomal plaque components BP230 and plectin connect the intermediate filaments cytoskeleton to the plasma membrane. They connect the basal layer to the basement membrane zone.

question: Which of the following is most abundant form of collagen present in dermis?
exp: Type I collagen is the predominant type of collagen present in the dermis accounting for approximately 80% of the collagen in dermis. It is highly vascular, largely acellular and primarily consists of the extracellular matrix of connective tissue. Type II collagen- Cailage. Type III collagen- reticular fibers, Granulation tissue (early), Blood vessel. Type IV collagen- Basement memberane

question: Prefilaggrin is found in which layer of epidermis?
exp: Prefilaggrin(precursor molecule) is found in the keratohyaline granules present in the stratum granulosum. Filaggrin is most abundantly present in Stratum corneum. Filaggrin - helps in filament aggregation

question: Superficial veins are found in which layer of skin:
exp: The aeries enter skin - Form a deep plexus - between the subcutaneous adipose tissue and the dermis to form a 'cutaneous' vessel network. Subpapillary plexus, which forms capillary loops entering the papillary dermis between the rete ridges.
